clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilates Exercise Program for Improving Core Strength, Balance and Functional Autonomy in Aged Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilates Exercise Program for Improving Core Strength, Balance and Functional Autonomy in Aged Women: Study Protocol for a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

collaborator.agency: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: This study is based on assess and contrast isometric and isokinetic core strength, static and dynamic balance, the number of falls, and functional autonomy in three different old women groups after a 22 weeks 1) Pilates-based structured exercise program, 2) muscular structured exercise program, and 3) nonexercising.

detailed_description.textblock: Real life conditions require concurrent attention-demanding tasks, increasing the risk of falling and contributing to disability. Pilates-based exercise is proposed as a combined core and mental training program grounded on learning functionally effective postural sets and motor patterns, that will provide better results than a muscular exercise program in old women trunk strength, the risk of falling, functional autonomy and other complementary physical and mental functions. This is a 34-weeks cluster randomized controlled trial in which 80 independent old women will be allocated to a Pilates-based exercise program, a muscular exercise program, and a no-exercise control group. The intervention is divided into 22 weeks of supervised exercise and a 12 weeks follow-up. Primary outcome will be isokinetic and isometric trunk and hip flexion-extension strength, static and dynamic balance, the number of falls, and functional autonomy. Secondary outcome will include body composition, habitual physical activity and a standardized gerontological evaluation composed of body composition, daily physical activity, the independence to develop basic and instrumental activities of daily living, and the cognitive, affective and social function assessment. Every item will be measured at baseline, 22 and 34 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in trunk and hip isokinetic and isometric muscular flexion/extension peak torque, given in Newtons per meter.
primary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
primary_outcome.description: assessed on a Biodex System III Pro Isokinetic Dynamometer (Biodex Medical System, NY, USA).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in displacement of the center of pressure (millimeters) and time spent standing on two feet, tandem and monopodal display.
primary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
primary_outcome.description: assessed with a portable force platform (Kistler, 9286AA).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in time spent to accomplish the Timed Up and Go test for dynamic balance
primary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
primary_outcome.description: participants will be given instructions to stand up from a chair, walk 3 meters as quickly and safely as possible, turn around a cone, walk back and sit down.

primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed every 4 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in time to accomplish the protocol GDLAM for assessing functional autonomy
primary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
primary_outcome.description: protocol GDLAM consists of: 10 meters walking speed, standing up from a chair during 5 times, get up the floor from the ventral decubitus position, standing up from a chair and walk around a triangular circuit, and putting on and taking off a T-shirt.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in bone mineral, lean mass (nonbone), and fat mass for total body, head, chest, trunk, hip, right and left legs and arms regions.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
secondary_outcome.description: assessed with a dual-energy X-ray bone densitometry (XR-46, Norland Corp., Fort Atkinson, USA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in score from the Physical Activity Scale for the Elderly (PASE) to measure habitual physical activity.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
secondary_outcome.description: The PASE is comprised of self-reported occupational, household and leisure items over a one-week period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Katz scale index to assess the independence to develop basic activities of daily living
secondary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
secondary_outcome.description: It summarizes performance in six functions: namely, bathing, dressing, going to toilet, transferring, continence and feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Lawton and Brody's scale index to assess the independence to develop instrumental activities of daily living
secondary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
secondary_outcome.description: It encomprises eight functional abilities, such as the use of the telephone, shopping, food preparation, housekeeping, laundry, mode of transport, taking medication and handling finances.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Mini-Mental State score to assess the cognitive function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
secondary_outcome.description: It covers orientation, memory, attention, calculation, recall and language

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Geriatric Depression Scale of Yesavage (GDSy) score to determine the affective function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: "Changes from baseline at 22 weeks" and "Changes from baseline at 34 weeks"
secondary_outcome.description: It is composed of 15 questions that cover a wide variety of topics relevant to depression, such as somatic complaints, cognitive complaints, motivations, future/past orientation, self-image, losses, agitation, obsessive traits, and mood itself.

arm_group.description: Incorporate Pilates principles to stimulate core muscles in a dynamic and static way, and exercising arms and legs complementarity with balance as an essential part of standing exercises.
To train core muscles in a dynamic and static way, and exercising arms and legs complementarity with balance as an essential part of standing exercises.
Healthy active but nonexercising old women

intervention.description: 2 sessions/week, 1 hour/session during 22 weeks. Intensity determined from 6 to 9 points, controlled by the Resistance exercise scale of perceived exertion (OMNI-RES).
2 sessions/week, 1 hour/session during 22 weeks. Intensity determined from 6 to 9 points, controlled by the Resistance exercise scale of perceived exertion (OMNI-RES).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged from 60 to 80 years, physically and mentally able to enroll in the exercise programs. The level of education, toxic habits, medical treatment and/or diseases that can affect musculoskeletal or cardiovascular systems, mental illness, urinary incontinence, the presence of oedema and high blood pressure will be controlled.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or prior participation in a structured Pilates-based or muscular exercise program in the past 3 months, and visual or auditory impairments not corrected with glasses or hearing aid. Each participant will also be at least 80% compliant to the exercise.
